title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 800.14 - Emergency medical technicians certified by states bordering new york
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 800.14 - Emergency medical technicians certified by states bordering new york

State Regulations

Emergency medical technicians certified by Vermont, Massachusetts, Connecticut, New Jersey, or Pennsylvania may practice in New

York State without New York State certification, while (a) transferring a
patient across the border between New York State and the certifying state or
(b) providing emergency medical care in New York State pursuant to a mutual aid
agreement with a New York State-certified or registered ambulance service. The
mutual aid agreement must be in writing, signed by an authorized officer of
both services, and must delineate the protocols to be adhered to by the
out-of-state emergency medical technicians and shall be on file with the
department. Notes

York State Register June 5, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 23, eff. 6/5/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
